title: Creative Director
description: Lead the creative vision, direction, and execution across branding, digital marketing, design, and AI-driven creative projects. This role demands strategic thinking, storytelling excellence, and hands-on leadership.
responsibilities: Oversee creative strategy, concept development, and campaign design for digital, branding, and integrated marketing projects
Lead the creative team—designers, writers, strategists—in producing compelling assets and experiences
Translate brand goals and client objectives into high-impact ideas and visual narratives
Ensure consistency of brand voice, visual identity, and creative excellence across all deliverables
Collaborate with strategy, marketing, performance, and UI/UX teams to drive integrated creative solutions
Present creative concepts and pitches to clients, leadership, and partners with clarity and impact
Inspire, mentor, and guide teams while fostering a high-performance, innovation-driven culture
Stay updated with design trends, AI creative tools, digital platforms, and new-age storytelling techniques
Oversee multi-project timelines, prioritization, and reviews to ensure high-quality, timely deliverables
requirements: 7–9 years of experience in advertising, digital marketing, or creative agencies
Exceptional communication, presentation, and storytelling skills
Strong leadership and team management abilities with a collaborative mindset
Expertise in creative direction, branding, digital campaigns, and visual communication
Ability to think conceptually while executing with precision and creativity
Familiarity with AI-accelerated creative tools and modern digital design methods
niceToHave: MBA preferred
Additional qualifications in Design from IID or similar reputed design institutions
Experience in next-generation AI + digital design workflows
Hands-on involvement in branding, motion design, and campaign ideation
benefits: A leadership opportunity to shape the agency's creative direction
Access to cutting-edge AI, design, and marketing technologies
High-impact work across multiple brands and digital environments
Competitive compensation and high-growth career trajectory
A creative, open, and innovation-led work environment

title: Campaign Manager
description: Develop and execute multi-channel digital marketing campaigns, including social media, email, paid search, display, and content-driven initiatives.
aboutRole: The Campaign Manager will be responsible for planning, launching, and managing digital marketing campaigns across multiple channels — both direct and indirect. This role ensures that every marketing initiative is aligned with brand strategy, business objectives, and target audience goals. The Campaign Manager acts as the central link between brand marketing, creative, SEO/SMO, and content teams, driving successful execution and measurable results for the organization's marketing programs.
responsibilities: Develop and execute multi-channel digital marketing campaigns, including social media, email, paid search, display, and content-driven initiatives
Oversee campaign planning, scheduling, budgeting, and reporting to ensure timely delivery and optimal ROI
Collaborate with Brand Marketing Executives, SEO/SMO specialists, and design teams to create integrated campaigns
Manage campaign workflows, ensuring all marketing assets and messages are consistent with the company's brand voice and positioning
Monitor campaign performance, track KPIs (CTR, engagement, conversions), and optimize ongoing campaigns for improved outcomes
Coordinate with Sales, Product, and Development teams to align marketing activities with business goals
Manage relationships with external agencies, partners, and media outlets for joint promotional and branding initiatives
Maintain an understanding of market trends, emerging platforms, and competitor activities to refine strategy

requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Business, or Communications
3–5 years of hands-on experience in digital marketing or campaign management, preferably in an agency or brand-driven environment
Strong project management, analytical, and interpersonal skills
Ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously under tight deadlines

Excellent communication and presentation skills
niceToHave: Experience with marketing automation tools (HubSpot, Marketo, Zoho Campaigns, or similar)

Familiarity with CRM and campaign management tools such as Salesforce, Asana, or Smartsheet
